content: In Python, how can I extract the last 9 items of a list? I am able to get the first 9 items using slicing with the syntax `num_list[0:9]`, but I am having trouble figuring out how to adapt this for the last 9 items.

To extract the last 9 items of a list in Python, you can use negative indexing in your slicing syntax. Here's how you can do it:

```python
last_9_items = num_list[-9:]
```

This approach works because negative indices in Python count from the end of the list. So, `-9` refers to the ninth item from the end of the list, and the slice `[-9:]` gives you all elements from that point to the end of the list. If your list has fewer than 9 items, this will simply return the entire list.
